feedback: Some docstrings lack detailed descriptions of exceptions raised.
A few comments are redundant with the code (e.g., '# HELLO WORLD').
Some test methods could benefit from more detailed docstrings explaining the test scenarios.
suggestions: Add more detailed docstrings for methods that raise exceptions, explaining the conditions under which they occur.
Remove redundant comments that don't add value beyond what the code already expresses.
Enhance test method docstrings to clearly describe the test scenarios and expected outcomes.
strengths: Most functions and classes have clear and informative docstrings.
Docstrings follow a consistent format, making them easy to read and understand.
Important configuration and setup steps are well-commented.
Test cases are generally well-documented with clear purpose statements.
